Reviews.Title: “excellent location for a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdeeb
Reviews.Content: i spent 5 nights in Cartoon hotel in taksim area-last week Pros of the hotel: 1- of course the first thing and undeniable is the location , its actualy better location to isteklal street parallel to Isteklal street- less than 5 mins walk to it- less than 5 mins walk to the main bus station whre u can buy the tickets and membership passs card s that cover all istanbul transportation ( bus- autobus-and underground), under the hotel is also a bus station named trablsi stop ,which is also the street name. bus 46H taken from this stop will take u all the way to sultan ahmed area ( the historical part with sultan ahmet mosque and hajia sofia etc) all the wayback to taksim area. 2- also the hotel as i mention near taksim sq where you can take the tube- underground transport for 2 Turkish lira that takes u to Osman beiy resturants and real shopping street 3- the front desk staff are good and efficient when u ask them for translation to some turkish pargraphs and terms they offer help-or adresses or telephone numbers they offer healp with a smile>reception team are good ( Ebrahim specialy) , even the bill boy is polite and helpful 3- breakfast buffet is ok..every day the same but ok, try thier black honey with seseme paste tahini its delicious now the Cons: the hotel rooms are small, luckliy i was given room 117 first floor single room so it was ok -with a safe in room the room is modern with tea coffe boiler- but i was alone, i wonder if the room would accomodate 2 persons comfortably... the bed is good and they offer special pillow for extra comfort. the bath room is very small and someimtes bad smell comes out of drain i dont know why..there is hot cold water in hand> first floor made the street noise heard all day and night specialy that there is a night club close by next to hotel ( Ekko) so maybe this would not be best for light sleepers..unless u close the windows all day and night, for me it was not such a big hassle since the wether out was already cold so i had to close windows. house keeping is good but no english what so ever-BIG problem try learning some turkish terms before you land in this country..turks are proud of thier languiage and they wont talk english at all ! u feel lost in this issue but having said that they are helpful ppl. the waiters at breakfast area were not smiling they looked pissed, shouting somtimes and making sounds with cups and plates on table, they dont talk english and i didnt feel at ease with them breakfast is on till 10 am which is good and somtimes till even 10:30. the hotel in general is clean but needs renovation done to rooms ( bathrooms) and hallway carpets,,etc since you wont spend much time in hotel so this hotel will do spec at end of day when your feet is killing you from touring the city you want a hotel near by the bus stops and metro stops and Isteklal street where you will usualy spend your evening since Isteklal street stays live and open till late hours of night, i noticed many taxi cars stop under/near /infront of the hotel at night , with drivers chatting and taking shisha so they are abit loud and noisy. one big problem-unfortuatly during my whole stay i was able from my bed room all the sounds in the hallway and next bed room,door slamming every 5 minutes , noisy neighbors ,loud noises inside theri room,i didnt really sleep and rest except when they checked out of their room. near the hotel is a small super market where u can buy essentials. this hotel is boutique hotel but i like boutique hotels from now on :) ill attach few photos of the street from my window, and for the breakfast area..etc

Reviews.Title: “Nice days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NikGeo
Reviews.Content: Very good location. You can easily walk down Istiklal avenue, where you can do shopping, eat and have a drink. You have access to the buses and the metro (at Kabatas using the funicular), to visit the old city (Sultan Ahmet). Excellent service in the hotel. The stuff was friendly always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, budget, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelner
Reviews.Content: I've just red the reviews and I really can not understand why people say that this is a bad hotel, and never go back. I stayed there last summer with my boyfriend. At first we were very angry with the receptionist cause they couldn't find our reservation. The stuff was not very friendly at this time. After a few hours an some phones, we found out that the travel agent had booked our room with the help of the manager and assistant manager did'n know that. The hotel was full and they gave us a really small room with no window. The window that it was there, had a view at the emergency ladder. Ok, the decoration is so kitch. The hotel is big and like a labyrinth but not so difficult. The elevator is small. When we were there too many big families were there, too many children yelling and screaming and calling from their room telephone to ours in the middle of the night. That was horrible but it was not hotel's fault. The guy in the reception I think was from Lebanon. Really cute! :) but a bit snob. Not very helfull stuff but not bad either. The breakfast was great! Too many option as most hotels in Istanbul. I loved the honeycomb! It was delicious! Every morning they had a big wooden base with koneycomp and you can cut as much as you want. It was clean hotel, with spacious bathroom. Not too big but really good. Bath products were there every day. (soap is very nice perfumed!) It might not be a 4 star, but not only 3 either. I mean there are some defaults but I would surely recomend it. It is a taksim square hotel, clean, quiet with really good breakfast and very reasonable price. I always prefer to stay at the taksim side of Istanbul and not at Sultan Ahmet, so this is ideal location. It also has a roof restaurant (Lebaneze as far as I can remember) but it is not budget. Nicw view of the night city and really nice food. But a bit expensive for my pocket. I would definitely stay there again, I just hope I'll be in an other room :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in everything”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed A
Reviews.Content: I did travel last 4th of march to spend my honeymoon there in Istanbul for 7 nights 8 days , really I did enjoy every moment I spent there in Istanbul , specially my stay in the Hotel , it was amazing experience to stay there , at the first we were reading about how small is the hotel , and the lobby etcâ€¦., but nothing to be judged without seeing it with your own eyes , we went there we found that how big are their rooms , we stayed in room 322 big room on the 3rd floor and it was Excellent . We were very fascinated from different things , I reall wana to share it with all of you . 1. (Excellent ) Location â€¦near from everything , 2 minutes walking to Istiklal street the most vital street in Istanbul , 2 minutes walking to Taksim square Metro station , street never sleeps, very safe till midnight and after , 20 minutes by funicular ( Metro ) to reach Sultan Ahmet , the nearest hotel in this area from Taksim square . 2. How the staff are very amiable and nice starting from their cute assistant manager till all receptionist staff , helpful , caring . 3. Clean . 4. From my own point of view , the hotel has a very competitive good price comparing that with many advantages he has . Go ahead and you will never regret . Many thanks for the assistant manager and the whole staff .

Reviews.Title: “overall a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Sim654
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small ,some of them are really really small.... good staff... breakfast was fine too but they have the same thing every morning... the location is just perfect... its right next to taksim square its rated 4 star officially... All in all i would rate it 3 star.... its not bad for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “one night”
Reviews.Author: mur a
Reviews.Content: i stayed one night; the room was too small; it was L shaped; was diffucult to access the other side when you get out the air conditioner stops; so it was too cold when you come back; and not enough for heating the room; bathroom was really cold; and there was no heating system in there the curtain was small for the window the room number was 106; too much noise came from outside the staff of reception was helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Trip with Boyfriend”
Reviews.Author: TDHArizona
Reviews.Content: My beautiful boyfriend booked this hotel for us. Our room was 223 which was at the end of the hall - excellent. Very spacious and quiet. The hotel is located in noisy Taksim so you could hear some street noise but minimal. There is a nice breakfast serviced. Downside - lifts are small so handling luggage is difficult. Hallways are in bad need of repair and updating. Staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel I have stayed”
Reviews.Author: davidchoo
Reviews.Content: Was at this hotel for a night and was saddened by extremely small size of the room. In addition, one needed to negotiate around the narrow corridors to search for the room. The 2 lifts were also small only for a couple to squeeze in and it was not easy to find the hotel lobby. Spending a night there was like confining yourself in a dungeon. When we asked why the room was stuffy, the counter staff replied it was cold now in Istanbul so the central air-con was shutdown. We could only rely on a small window hatch for the flow of fresh airinto our room. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nousha_87
Reviews.Content: if you r a budget traveller who cares more about being in the middle of action, cartoon hotel is the place to be! right in Taksim Sq. and a 5 mins walk to Istiklal street in which you will find the exciting night life, you can go shopping and many restaurants. The breakfast was really good, and they have free wireless internet service. Overall was perfect for my trip with my best friend.. good price, perfect location and an excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I will never book again in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nabil_bebawi
Reviews.Content: Hotel only advantage is the LOCATION, but you could find hundreds of hotels in this area. Rooms are very small with bad odor, Air conditioning system is central so you could not adjust your room temperature. The hotel needs complete renovation, I don't recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Thump thump Boom Boom”
Reviews.Author: wessbest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cartoon Hotel form Oct.10 to Oct.18.2011 It is very well located across the street from Taksim Sq. and the Cable car Metro and 3 minute walk from Istiklal Jadeci, a main shopping walking street with lots of restaurants. Breakfast was excellent . I was put in a tiny tiny room (306) on the first night but was moved to a more spacious accommodations the next day .So where is the problem ? There is a disco (EKOO) in the adjacent building that starts around 10pm and goes on till 5am .The thundering bass sound goes right through Cartoon like a hot knife thought butter.....So if you want a bit of sleep, then ask for a high floor (6th,7th or 8th) and go deep to rooms on the opposite side of the disco such as room 510,511,512 etc. or the same rooms on higher floors. The staff at the front desk were cheerful and most helpful. The Disney cartoon theme is REALLY unnecessary...they should phase it out. Fresh paint and new carpets are needed...........Wess Best.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Taksim Square and Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: LAPlatinum
Reviews.Content: My title is about the best I can say for Cartoon, an oddly named hotel that is in much need of a complete renovation. Whether it be the garish furniture in the lobby or the circus funhouse-style hallways that slant strangely, this place is in the 400s for suitability for a very good reason. I ended up at Cartoon because of a conference, so had not vote in the matter. I had upgraded to a suite when on seeing the regular rooms I knew I was in for trouble. Although it was billed as non-smoking, the room reeked of smoke for the entire five days regardless of the air conditioning I kept on. Matter of fact, it was probably the vents that were pumping in the smoke! It's always disturbing staying in a room with dirty carpets and stained walls--particularly the bathroom walls! I found each morning the shower ran relentlessly onto the floor and had the maid not left her cart outside the door every night, I would have had no way to gather enough towels to stop the flood. Even in reporting this to the staff, their efforts could not remedy what must have been a leaky door or some such thing. The toiletries were cheap and useless, but I had brought my own from a lovely Sofitel property where I had stayed the week before, so I was fine. One morning, I had to work on a project, only to be overtaken with noxious fumes coming under the door from the hallway. In peering out, I noted the maintenance crew repainting the walls with an obviously-toxic paint whose fumes have got to cause cancer. I begged them to stop, but by then the smell had infested my room. Remarkably, once the paint dried, the hallways looked no better for the work. Breakfast: About a C-. I have yet to find bad bread in Turkey, where a friend of mine says emphatically that Turks love their pastry. So, cheese, a few nice olives, and a roll were about all that were suitable. The apples, although fresh all over Turkey and the planet now, were mealy and tasteless. The tea, which is a mainstay of any Turkish meal--or between, for that matter--was dispensed from a machine that also made lattes. This meant the tea invariably had milk residue in it. While I often like my tea with milk, I prefer to add it, not get some weird slime in it. Cartoon, fix the tea issue! I will say this about the bed. It was clean and it was comfortable. After all the horror stories I hear about bedbugs, I am vigilant, but none so far as I could see. The only problem was the curio cabinet in the corner with plastic Winnie the Poo inside. Its internal light would NOT go off and so I had to black out the light with a dark shirt. I told you. Weird. All in all, I would never stay here again under any circumstance. Istanbul is not cheap, but there are far better properties to stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's where u want to stay”
Reviews.Author: Abostiet
Reviews.Content: Best place-clean rooms but a bit small-very good house keeping-not the best the customer service but mainly cuz of the weak English, totally recomended

Reviews.Title: “good location , nothing else .”
Reviews.Author: Waleed_Eman
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a very good location so close to teh shopping area , but nothing else to expect from it . - the rooms are too too small less than the 20m2 ,just one person can move and the other should be onteh bed as there is no other place to step on . - the staff is not friendly , and they can hardly understand or speak English ( not all of them) - the window is almost closed by the building beside the hotel , - the room was too hot , and teh |AC was just working as HOT , when we asked the reception , they told us that they consider this season as winter , so they don't turn the AC to the cold mode . - the breakfast buffet variety is very very limited and quality is moderate , - it can be diifficultly considered as 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cartoon hotel . average .”
Reviews.Author: nasser_alothman
Reviews.Content: Disadvantages: Carton walls ! Small rooms , corridors and reception . Some staff are helpful , some not . I booked for 2 renovated rooms and got the old rooms . They changed the next day and gave me one of the rooms a deluxe room ( room 125 ) . Advantages : location near Taksim sq . Smoking is allowed in all rooms . Nice and clean breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “best location with ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: drcleopatra
Reviews.Content: i've been there last year in september, at first in istanbul you are busy around the clock and all what u need is a clean lovely room to sleep in and a well standard hotel , with a good location so frankly cartoon has it all positive points: excellent location in taksim square in front of the famous istiklal street the main shopping and restaurant street , and even live shows by amateur bands takes place. also infront if the subground and bus station and lot of taxis,so transportation is quiet easy and clean the rooms are spacious , cozy and lovely furnished , clean bathroom and room service was so perfect the room was tidy and nicely smelled every day one of the receptionists was very polite and helpful besides he speak comprehensable english free wifi all over the place lebanon moon restaurant on the top floor galss panorama showing istanbul for dinner i saw it but honestly i didn't eat coz we loved to dine outside in different restaurants. slightly negative aspects: narrow reception , so family can't sit to have a chat there the stuff NEVER SMILES NOR FRIENDLY LOOKS ( except for the reception guy i told abt) but maybe this is a cultural differnce bet egypt and turkey coz here we never stop smiling ..:D so it wasn't a big deal the breakfast was o.k not wide variety and lack of turkish food but it was niece like u needn't more than egss cheese butter on breakfast tip:the main problem and its a universal one in such a touristic country they don't speak any language other than turkish but they are intellegent enof to understand what u want like if u want to say " i want to go to dolombace palace" just say " dolmabace plz" and they will show u the way . to sum up TURKEY IS SUCH AN AMAZING COUNTRY IN ALL ASPECTS SHOPPING TOURISM NIGHT LIFE AND PEOPLE TOO , and i would consider going to this hotel again or to the fornt one in the same location hilton marmara ....and if this ur first visit go there and u'll know how to reach each location in a catch better than to go in a far located hotel .

Reviews.Title: “I liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluesky0103
Reviews.Content: The room is well furnished. new furniture good location near Taksim square the service is acceptable breakfast was very good but I wished I found more turkish food

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average property”
Reviews.Author: Frank_Jr_II
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just in front of Taksim Square a very good place for nightlife and shopping with easy access to all forms of transportation. I stayed here for several weeks for business and visited different rooms. One tip: some of the rooms are renovated and are much better with modernized beds clean bathrooms and flat TV etc. If they give you one of the old rooms negotiate and ask to be transferred to one of the renovated ones. Rooms overlooking the main street will get some noise especially during weekends. Rooms in the other side of the building are ok although you wont have any view from your window. The Taksim area is alright, you can walk in the street at any time during day and nights but do not enter the streets to the south of the hotel. Tarlabasi is one of the most dangerous parts of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nazlibus
Reviews.Content: I've been so many times in instanbul and I can say now without hesitation that this hotel is the best we can find there. The service is wonderful, the rooms are cleaned up minimum 2 times per day and you're never disturbed. The food is really incredible and the service at the bar/restaurant is of very high quality!

Reviews.Title: “functional at best”
Reviews.Author: LizMBirmingham_UK
Reviews.Content: Yes the location is good, the breakfast was Ok and the beds were comfy but the place is desperately in need of a makeover and a good steam clean. Carpets and furniture a bit old and dirty looking, our curtains were hanging off and the toilet roll holder not fixed properly to the wall etc. Needs some serious TLC. Probably not been decorated in the last 20-25 years at a guess. Nothing too scary or horrible to worry about if you ahve already booked (sheets etc clean and the cleaning staff are doing their best), but not much to like in the rooms either to be honest. Glad to be home :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: mona_zahran
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really more than perfect just 5 min. from Taksim square and Isteklal st., we also liked the cartoon characters all over the place, the staff was so friendly, room and bathroom were always clean, the breakfast was nice meeting all people tastes :) Yes the hotel (corridors,elevators,rooms,bathrooms,â€¦) are so small but we didnâ€™t care about it cuz we werenâ€™t spending that much time there we always return after a long day exhausted to sleep in a very clean room â€œ211â€� The only problem is that you could hear any noise outside your room from neighbors due to the thin wallsâ€¦â€¦but still love Istanbul and love Cartoon hotel :))

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cairogirl82
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared of the negative reviews I read about this place before we went. However, after staying there I felt it was a pretty nice hotel for the amount of time we spent in Istanbul (5 days). The staff are friendly enough, the room is clean and the breakfast buffet is really nice (not that big but covers all tastes). The only issue we had with Cartoon was that the room we stayed in was really, really small (tiny in fact) but we didn't mind much because we rarely stayed in it except when we went to bed exhausted after a long day. Some people may also complain about the noise due to the hotel overlooking the main street and the thinness of the walls so you can sometimes hear your neighbours but again, we weren't really bothered by those things (apparently we're really easy to please people:)) Oh and I don't really get the people who were annoyed by the cartoons all over the place, the place's name says it all; it's a cartoon themed hotel so expect a lot of Micky and Donald shaped stuff all over the place. The best thing about the hotel is the location; 5 minutes from Taksim square and Istiklal st. There's also a huge number of restaurants (local and fast food) around the area. All in all, I wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Joke”
Reviews.Author: rik2011
Reviews.Content: The Cartoon hotel sure lives up its name. Imagine an outlived 70's hotel, pimped up with Disney figurines. Pieces de resistances are the 18th century gravures with cut outs of cartoon characters stuck on. Not to mention the plaster reliefs of Mickey and friends. The room price is no laughing matter. At 150 euro/night you expect something more serious. Value is a joke. The rooms and bathrooms are small, even the corridors. You'll feel more inside another comedy classic: "Being John Malkovich". If you open the elevator door, you hit the wall. On the ground floor you might even hit a pillar as you step out. The inspiration for service is Cruella. Location is top, right at Taksim square. Unfortunately, that also means honking cars all night long, so don't expect much sleep. That's all folks ...

Reviews.Title: “totally disappointing”
Reviews.Author: renal1
Reviews.Content: GOOD POINTS: convenient location near istiklal street and subway. they offer an ok breakfast. BAD POINTS: 1. staff, staff and staff. the staff at the reception are totally irresponsive, unhelpful and unfriendly * they took a long time during the check in and out (they claimed that the room was not cleaned yet so we had to stay at the reception for an hour) *gave us inaccurate info when we asked about the location of a pharmacy * they were rude when we asked to change our room. 2. the bathroom is very small and uncomfortable with no window, the ac was not working properly and nobody cared to fix it. there is no privacy bec the walls are like paper thin so we could hear the people in the neighbouring rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I DON'T ADVISE”
Reviews.Author: Nabil07
Reviews.Content: The only good point for this hotel is the location which is excellent. Otherwise, the room is very small and so the bathroom. There is a bad odor in the room, air conditioning without regulation, the room was so hot so we could not sleep well. Almost all channels on TV was turkish. This hotel should not exceed 3 stars..

Reviews.Title: “nice but not enough!”
Reviews.Author: wisesuzy
Reviews.Content: location is perfect close to taksim square. The rooms are not comfortable. The walls are so thin that you can hear the breathe of your neighbour:) not nice. Breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “hotel in the heart of taksim, istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Amelia81
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit and skeptical with the name CARTOON, however once checked-in, the hotel seemed so cute and sweet with a lot of Disney character in frames and dolls. It's value for money, the bed was comfy and the room equipped with basic amenities. The hotel fronting to the main road with easy access for variety of foods and shopping. Taxi and trem are also available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: serenitsa
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location to the Taksim Square. The problem was to the persons who had a room like 135 I think.. They had to go to the first floor and then go down 3 more floors.. It's like a labyrinth. But if you stay to a higher floor there is no problem. I didn't like also that when I asked for a map they told me that I had to pay 7 tl. I know that in hotels they offer small maps, at least the center of the city.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly, faceless international hotel, poor value”
Reviews.Author: UkAdventure
Reviews.Content: Breakfast room no windows, staff whipped food away almost before you had finished it. Unfriendly staff. Rooms very lacking in atmosphere, ridiculous cartoons everywhere, hence name. Over-priced much better hotels nearby for same or lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Benodon
Reviews.Content: Hotel is Ok - view from my room was fantastic - but a little bit too pricy. AC smelled (old) apart from that itâ€™s a nice place (if you like Cartoons of course)

Reviews.Title: “the only view you can see from your room is the (shaft),”
Reviews.Author: Manar_9
Reviews.Content: perfect location, near to istikalal street and the subway station, clean rooms, very good service, most of rooms dont have a view , the only thing you can see when you open your window is the shaft,

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: akisd2834
Reviews.Content: smelly hotel -garlic- and the worst unhelpful reception..they also didnt let friends come in hotel,they make me go down stairs from the bathroom ......very bad attitude never again..other hotels in taxim 4* are much better

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: amr909
Reviews.Content: i stayed in cartoon hotel for a week, the room is very clean with new furniture, the breakfast is more than great, the people working are very polite. the location is perfect. i had the best vacation ever. at last day the receptionist left his office to help me in getting a taxi to the airport with good price, thats how they are very good and helpfull. the only dissadvantage that the TV channels are all in turkey language.

Reviews.Title: “a non pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: triper_2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in this hotel in Sep 2009. The hotel is a mini-sized including reception, lobby, elevator, corridors and rooms. The bad things :1)small (3 person capacity) and lazy elevator. 2)narrow and maze shaped corridors 3)small room full of furniture making movements difficult 4)thin walls(you can hear breathing of the neighbors) 5)24 h noise in the room from motor vehicles and outside people 6)safe box in our room was not fixed to the wall so everyone could took it 7)malfunction of toilet siphon The goods:1)staff 2)breakfast 3)location 4)clean rooms Con: I certainly choose another hotel in Istanbul in another trip.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: waelfarhat
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for 4 nights in a very quite, modern double room (room 115),rooms with view on taksim square are noisy, since it is on a busy street.The bed,minibar and consol are covered with nice brown leather.the bathroom is very clean with a great bakadouch with massage facility.intercontinental breakfast with a wide variety of food.The location can't be beaten, 5 minutes walk to taksim square and istiklal street lots of shopping.Also you can take the metro,tram to different destinations.i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “barely two stars”
Reviews.Author: Ashour
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in this hotel with my children. The room given to us was very small on the first floor overlooking the back street. Late night this street becomes a place for picking up hockers. For two nights my kids and I did not sleep well because of the noise made by the hockers bargaining with their customers. I complained to the hotel reception and asked to change the room to the other side but they refused in a rude way and told me all their rooms are full. The location of the hotel is in taksim is convenient and close to many restaurants and means of transportation. The breakfast is good, may be it is the only thing in this hotel that is close to 4 stars level. Overall I can say that this hotel is far from being a four-star hotel and barely can make it to two starts level.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!!”
Reviews.Author: travelunlimited123
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I just got back from a trip to Istanbul and we stayed at the Cartoon Hotel for 5 nights/6days. We absolutely loved the hotel and being 2 single girls, we felt pretty safe! The rooms were quiet, clean, hairdryer available, cupboard and a safe, mini fridge/bar, tv, the beds were SO comfortable and made you wanna come back after a long tiring day of sight seeing, the bathroom was clean with hot water available at all times, the staff was VERY friendly and helpful. we were confused about locations to some banks we needed to exchange money from and travel agencies and they helped us and even drew a lil map for us so we knew where we were going. On one day, my friend's phone battery died and she didn't have a Nokia charger, and the staff at once agreed to keep the mobile at the front desk fr charging for 30 mins till we could come pick it up...at NO extra cost! They even allowed us to use the computer at the front desk to book our tickets online to ephesus coz our comp wouldn't work....n that too at NO extra cost! The breakfast was something we would look forward to every morning...amazing choice of food...olives, cream, honey, fruits, different kinds of fresh bread, cookies, diff kinds of cheese, turkey bacon slices, sausages, scrambled eggs, baked tomatoes with cheese, black coffee, white coffee, orange juice....and so many other kinds of food I don't know the names of :-) On 3 mornings , we were asked to come to "the moon" restaurant which is a restaurant on the 9th floor of the hotel...where breakfast was served and it was AMAZING! It has glass walls n a glass roof....n you can get the view of the city , soft music, great food....just perfect! On our third day, we had booked an early morning flight to Ephesus...and asked the night before if they could give us a wake up call at 4:30 am the next morning! Sure enough, the next morning, sharp at 4:30 we get a wakeup call...and another one 10 mins after just to make sure we were up for our flight! When we went down to the lobby, it was still dark outside and the staff refused to let us out alone to get a taxi and immediately arranged for a taxi which arrived in 5 mins. I must say that if i go to Istanbul again, I'm gonna stay at the Cartoon Hotel only! Great value for money, great location(walking distance from taksim square and the tramvay and amazing restaurants and shops, or any public transit) n great staff! We even gave them some sweets and a thank you note before we left! We were so pleased to have found such a great hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Cartoon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Tarlabasi Bulvari No.36-38 | Taksim, Istanbul 80080, Turkey
